from googlesearch import search
from groq import Groq
from json import load, dump
import datetime 
from dotenv import dotenv_values

env_vars = dotenv_values(".env")

username = env_vars.get("username")
Assistantname = env_vars.get("Assistantname")
GroqAPIKey = env_vars.get("GroqAPIKey")

client = Groq(api_key=GroqAPIKey)

# write your information here
System = f"""Hello, I am {username}, You are a very accurate and advanced AI chatbot named {Assistantname} which has real-time up-to-date information from the internet.
*** Provide Answers In a Professional Way, make sure to add full stops, commas, question marks, and use proper grammar.***"""

try:
    with open(r"Data\ChatLog.json", "r") as f:
        message = load(f)
except:
    with open(r"Data\ChatLog.json", "w") as f:
        dump([], f)

def GoogleSearch(query):
    results = list(search(query, num_results=5))
    Answer = f"The search results for '{query}' are:\n[start]\n"
    
    for i, result in enumerate(results, 1):
        Answer += f"{i}. {result}\n"  

    Answer += "[end]"
    return Answer

def AnswerModifier(answer):
    return "\n".join([line for line in answer.split("\n") if line.strip()])

SystemChatBot = [
    {"role": "system", "content": System},  # Fixed "System" -> "system"
    {"role": "user", "content": "Hi"},
    {"role": "assistant", "content": "How can I help you?"}
]

def Information():
    current_date_time = datetime.datetime.now()
    return f"""please use this real-time information if needed:
Day: {current_date_time.strftime("%A")}
Date: {current_date_time.strftime("%d")}
Month: {current_date_time.strftime("%B")}
Year: {current_date_time.strftime("%Y")}
Time: {current_date_time.strftime("%H")} hour {current_date_time.strftime("%M")} minutes {current_date_time.strftime("%S")} seconds
"""

def RealTimeSearchEngine(prompt):
    global SystemChatBot, message
    
    with open(r"Data\ChatLog.json", "r") as f:
        message = load(f)
    
    message.append({"role": "user", "content": prompt})  # Fixed f'{"prompt"}' -> prompt
    SystemChatBot.append({"role": "system", "content": GoogleSearch(prompt)})  # Fixed "System" -> "system"
    
    completion = client.chat.completions.create(
        model="llama3-70b-8192",
        messages=SystemChatBot + [{"role": "system", "content": Information()}] + message,  # Fixed "System" -> "system"
        max_tokens=1024,
        temperature=0.7,
        top_p=1,
        stream=True,
        stop=None
    )

    Answer = ""
    for chunk in completion:
        if chunk.choices[0].delta.content:
            Answer += chunk.choices[0].delta.content
    
    Answer = Answer.strip().replace("</s>", "")
    message.append({"role": "assistant", "content": Answer})
    
    with open(r"Data\ChatLog.json", "w") as f:
        dump(message, f, indent=4)
    
    SystemChatBot.pop()
    return AnswerModifier(Answer)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    while True:
        prompt = input("Enter your query >>> ")
        print(RealTimeSearchEngine(prompt))

import pygame
import random
import asyncio
import edge_tts
from dotenv import dotenv_values
import os

env_vars = dotenv_values(".env")
AssistantVoice = env_vars.get("AssistantVoice", "en-US-JennyNeural")  # ‚úÖ Set a default voice

async def TextToAudioFile(text) -> None:
    file_path = r"Data\speech.mp3"
    
    if os.path.exists(file_path):
        os.remove(file_path)  # ‚úÖ Fixed missing argument

    communicate = edge_tts.Communicate(text, AssistantVoice, pitch='+5Hz', rate='+13%')
    await communicate.save(file_path)

def TTS(Text, func=lambda r=None: True):
    try:
        loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
        loop.run_until_complete(TextToAudioFile(Text))  # ‚úÖ Uses an existing event loop
        
        pygame.mixer.init()
        pygame.mixer.music.load(r'Data\speech.mp3')
        pygame.mixer.music.play()

        while pygame.mixer.music.get_busy():
            if func() == False:
                break
            pygame.time.Clock().tick(10)
        return True
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error in TTS: {e}")
    finally:
        try:
            func(False)
            pygame.mixer.music.stop()
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Error in finally block: {e}")
        pygame.mixer.quit()  # ‚úÖ Quit mixer outside finally

def TextToSpeech(Text, func=lambda r=None: True):
    Data = [sentence for sentence in str(Text).split(".") if sentence.strip()]  # ‚úÖ Removes empty sentences
    responses = [
        "The rest of the result has been printed to the chat screen, kindly check it out sir.",
        "The rest of the text is now on the chat screen, sir, please check it.",
        "You can see the rest of the text on the chat screen, sir.",
        "The remaining part of the text is now on the chat screen, sir.",
        "Sir, you'll find more text on the chat screen for you to see.",
        "The rest of the answer is now on the chat screen, sir.",
        "Sir, please look at the chat screen, the rest of the answer is there.",
        "You'll find the complete answer on the chat screen, sir.",
        "The next part of the text is on the chat screen, sir.",
        "Sir, please check the chat screen for more information.",
        "There's more text on the chat screen for you, sir.",
        "Sir, take a look at the chat screen for additional text.",
        "You'll find more to read on the chat screen, sir.",
        "Sir, check the chat screen for the rest of the text.",
        "The chat screen has the rest of the text, sir.",
        "There's more to see on the chat screen, sir, please look.",
        "Sir, the chat screen holds the continuation of the text.",
        "You'll find the complete answer on the chat screen, kindly check it out sir.",
        "Please review the chat screen for the rest of the text, sir.",
        "Sir, look at the chat screen for the complete answer."
    ]
    
    if len(Data) > 4 and len(Text) >= 250:
        TTS(" ".join(Data[:2]) + ". " + random.choice(responses), func)  # ‚úÖ Uses cleaned Data
    else:
        TTS(Text, func)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    while True:
        text = input("Enter the text: ")
        TextToSpeech(text)

import serial
import time

def parseGPS(data):
    """
    Parse GPGGA NMEA sentence for latitude, longitude, and time.
    """
    if data[0:6] == "$GPGGA":
        s = data.split(",")
        if s[2] and s[4]:
            latitude = convertToDegree(s[2])  # Latitude
            lat_dir = s[3]  # N/S
            longitude = convertToDegree(s[4])  # Longitude
            long_dir = s[5]  # E/W
            gps_time = s[1][:6]  # UTC Time (hhmmss)

            print(f"Time (UTC): {gps_time[:2]}:{gps_time[2:4]}:{gps_time[4:6]}")
            print(f"Latitude: {latitude} {lat_dir}")
            print(f"Longitude: {longitude} {long_dir}")
        else:
            print("No GPS lock yet")
    else:
        print("Waiting for valid GPS data...")

def convertToDegree(raw_value):
    """
    Converts raw GPS coordinates to standard degree format.
    """
    raw_value = float(raw_value)
    degree = int(raw_value / 100)
    minutes = raw_value - (degree * 100)
    return degree + (minutes / 60)

def main():
    serial_port = "/dev/serial0"  # Default UART port on Raspberry Pi 4
    baud_rate = 9600  # Standard baud rate for GPS modules

    try:
        gps_serial = serial.Serial(serial_port, baud_rate, timeout=1)
        time.sleep(2)  # Allow GPS module to initialize

        print("Reading GPS data... Press Ctrl+C to exit")
        while True:
            gps_data = gps_serial.readline().decode('ascii', errors='replace')
            parseGPS(gps_data)
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        print("\nExiting program...")
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error: {e}")
    finally:
        if gps_serial:
            gps_serial.close()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

import serial
import time

# Initialize Serial Communication (Use correct port: /dev/ttyS0 or /dev/serial0)
ser = serial.Serial('/dev/serial0', 9600, timeout=1)
ser.flush()

def send_command(cmd):
    ser.write(f"{cmd}\n".encode('utf-8'))
    time.sleep(0.1)

# Example: Sending movement commands to Arduino
while True:
    command = input("Enter command (f = forward, b = backward, l = left, r = right, s = stop): ")
    send_command(command)

import cv2
import numpy as np
from tensorflow.keras.models import load_model

model = load_model("road_sign_model.h5")
cap = cv2.VideoCapture(0)

while True:
    ret, frame = cap.read()
    if not ret:
        break

    frame_resized = cv2.resize(frame, (224, 224))
    frame_expanded = np.expand_dims(frame_resized, axis=0)
    prediction = model.predict(frame_expanded)

    if prediction[0][0] > 0.5:  # Assuming 1st class is STOP sign
        print("STOP Sign Detected!")

    cv2.imshow("Camera Feed", frame)
    if cv2.waitKey(1) & 0xFF == ord('q'):
        break

cap.release()
cv2.destroyAllWindows()

import cv2
import tensorflow as tf
import numpy as np
import serial

# Connect to Arduino via Serial
arduino = serial.Serial('/dev/ttyUSB0', 9600)

# Load AI Model for Traffic Sign Detection
model = tf.keras.models.load_model("traffic_sign_model.h5")
CATEGORIES = ["Stop", "Speed Limit", "Pedestrian", "Traffic Light"]

camera = cv2.VideoCapture(0)

def detect_signs():
    while True:
        success, frame = camera.read()
        if not success:
            break

        img = cv2.resize(frame, (32, 32)) / 255.0
        img = np.expand_dims(img, axis=0)
        
        # Predict Traffic Sign
        prediction = model.predict(img)
        class_index = np.argmax(prediction)
        detected_sign = CATEGORIES[class_index]

        # Send command to Arduino
        if detected_sign == "Stop":
            arduino.write(b'S')
        elif detected_sign == "Speed Limit":
            arduino.write(b'L')
        elif detected_sign == "Traffic Light":
            arduino.write(b'T')

        # Display Result
        cv2.putText(frame, detected_sign, (50, 50), cv2.FONT_HERSHEY_SIMPLEX, 1, (0, 255, 0), 2)
        cv2.imshow("Traffic Sign Detection", frame)

        if cv2.waitKey(1) & 0xFF == ord('q'):
            break

camera.release()
cv2.destroyAllWindows()

import serial
import time
import firebase_admin
from firebase_admin import credentials, db
from geopy.distance import geodesic

# Firebase Configuration
cred = credentials.Certificate("your-firebase-credentials.json")
firebase_admin.initialize_app(cred, {'databaseURL': 'https://your-firebase-db.firebaseio.com'})

# GPS Setup (Raspberry Pi Serial Port)
gps_serial = serial.Serial("/dev/serial0", baudrate=9600, timeout=1)

# Predefined Route (Correct Path)
correct_route = [(19.0760, 72.8777), (19.0800, 72.8800), (19.0840, 72.8850)]  # Example GPS points

def read_gps():
    while True:
        line = gps_serial.readline().decode('utf-8', errors='ignore')
        if line.startswith('$GPGGA'):  # Extract Latitude & Longitude
            parts = line.split(',')
            if parts[2] and parts[4]:
                latitude = float(parts[2]) / 100
                longitude = float(parts[4]) / 100
                return (latitude, longitude)
        time.sleep(1)

def is_off_route(vehicle_location, correct_route, threshold=50):
    """Check if vehicle is off the predefined route"""
    for point in correct_route:
        distance = geodesic(vehicle_location, point).meters
        if distance < threshold:
            return False  # ‚úÖ Vehicle is on route
    return True  # ‚ùå Vehicle is off-route

while True:
    location = read_gps()
    if location:
        print(f"üìç Vehicle Location: {location}")

        # üîπ Send GPS Data to Firebase
        db.reference("/vehicle/location").set({
            "latitude": location[0],
            "longitude": location[1]
        })

        # üîπ Check if Vehicle is Off-Route
        if is_off_route(location, correct_route):
            print("üö® ALERT: Vehicle is off the route!")
            db.reference("/vehicle/alert").set({"message": "Vehicle is off-route!"})
        else:
            print("‚úÖ Vehicle is on the correct route.")

    time.sleep(5)  # Update every 5 seconds

import gpsd
import firebase_admin
from firebase_admin import credentials, db
from geopy.distance import geodesic
import pyttsx3  # Text-to-Speech for audio warning

# üîπ Initialize Firebase
cred = credentials.Certificate("your-firebase-credentials.json")
firebase_admin.initialize_app(cred, {'databaseURL': 'https://your-firebase-db.firebaseio.com'})

# üîπ Connect to GPSD
gpsd.connect()

# üîπ Predefined Correct Route (Example GPS points)
correct_route = [(19.0760, 72.8777), (19.0800, 72.8800), (19.0840, 72.8850)]  # Example path

# üîπ Setup Text-to-Speech Engine
tts = pyttsx3.init()
tts.setProperty('rate', 150)  # Adjust speed of voice

def get_gps_location():
    """Fetches real-time location from GPS module."""
    packet = gpsd.get_current()
    return (packet.lat, packet.lon)

def is_off_route(vehicle_location, correct_route, threshold=50):
    """Check if vehicle is off the predefined route."""
    for point in correct_route:
        distance = geodesic(vehicle_location, point).meters
        if distance < threshold:
            return False  # ‚úÖ Vehicle is on route
    return True  # ‚ùå Vehicle is off-route

def send_alert():
    """Send alert message to Firebase"""
    db.reference("/vehicle/alert").set({"message": "üö® Vehicle is off-route!"})

    # üîä Give Audio Warning
    tts.say("Warning! Wrong Route! Please turn back.")
    tts.runAndWait()

while True:
    location = get_gps_location()
    print(f"üìç Vehicle Location: {location}")

    # üîπ Send GPS Data to Firebase for Live Tracking
    db.reference("/vehicle/location").set({
        "latitude": location[0],
        "longitude": location[1]
    })

    # üîπ Check if Vehicle is Off-Route
    if is_off_route(location, correct_route):
        print("üö® ALERT: Vehicle is off the route!")
        send_alert()
    else:
        print("‚úÖ Vehicle is on the correct route.")

    time.sleep(5)  # Update every 5 seconds

import serial
import json
import requests

BLUETOOTH_PORT = "/dev/rfcomm0"  # Adjust according to your Raspberry Pi
BAUD_RATE = 9600
SERVER_URL = "http://your-server-ip:5000/sensor-data"

ser = serial.Serial(BLUETOOTH_PORT, BAUD_RATE)

while True:
    try:
        data = ser.readline().decode('utf-8').strip()
        sensor_data = json.loads(data)  # Convert JSON string to dictionary

        # Send to web server
        requests.post(SERVER_URL, json=sensor_data)
        
        print("Sent to server:", sensor_data)
    except Exception as e:
        print("Error:", e)

import Adafruit_DHT
import smbus
import serial
import requests

DHT_SENSOR = Adafruit_DHT.DHT11
DHT_PIN = 17
MPU_ADDR = 0x68
GPS_PORT = "/dev/serial0"
SERVER_URL = "http://your-server-ip:5000/sensor-data"

# I2C Setup for MPU6050
bus = smbus.SMBus(1)
bus.write_byte_data(MPU_ADDR, 0x6B, 0)  # Wake up MPU6050

gps = serial.Serial(GPS_PORT, 9600, timeout=1)

while True:
    # Read Temperature
    humidity, temperature = Adafruit_DHT.read(DHT_SENSOR, DHT_PIN)

    # Read MPU6050 Acceleration
    accel_x = bus.read_word_data(MPU_ADDR, 0x3B)
    
    # Read GPS Data
    gps_data = gps.readline().decode("utf-8").strip()

    sensor_data = {
        "temperature": temperature,
        "humidity": humidity,
        "accel_x": accel_x,
        "gps_data": gps_data
    }

    # Send to web server
    requests.post(SERVER_URL, json=sensor_data)
    
    print("Sent to server:", sensor_data)

from flask import Flask, request, render_template
import sqlite3

app = Flask(__name__)

def insert_data(sensor_data):
    conn = sqlite3.connect("database.db")
    c = conn.cursor()
    c.execute("INSERT INTO sensor_data (data) VALUES (?)", (str(sensor_data),))
    conn.commit()
    conn.close()

@app.route("/sensor-data", methods=["POST"])
def sensor_data():
    data = request.json
    insert_data(data)
    return "Data received!", 200

@app.route("/")
def dashboard():
    conn = sqlite3.connect("database.db")
    c = conn.cursor()
    c.execute("SELECT * FROM sensor_data ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 10")
    data = c.fetchall()
    conn.close()
    return render_template("index.html", data=data)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    app.run(host="0.0.0.0", port=5000, debug=True)

import os
import pandas as pd

# Paths
image_folder = "dataset/images/"
label_folder = "dataset/labels/"

# Read label files and create CSV
data = []
for label_file in os.listdir(label_folder):
    if label_file.endswith(".txt"):
        image_name = label_file.replace(".txt", ".jpeg")  # Match image name
        with open(os.path.join(label_folder, label_file), "r") as f:
            label = f.read().strip()  # Read class label
        data.append([image_name, label])

# Convert to DataFrame & save CSV
df = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=["image", "label"])
df.to_csv("dataset/labels.csv", index=False)

print("‚úÖ Labels saved to dataset/labels.csv")
